website_summaries.verdict: Long rod at 10 or 12 ft., yet it remains lightweight. Offers a good value for this type of fishing rod.
pros: Rubber shrink tube handle prevents slippage
Results in extremely long casting distances
cons: Doesn't work as well for simple fishing needs
Some reels will not fit this rod because of guide placement

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I got the 12’ rod. The action is for heavy lures and bigger fish. The rod itself has a good seat and the guides are well wrapped and finished. For the money, it’s hard to beat. I’m a stickler for spine true rods and mine was wrapped about 12 degrees off center. I asked for a replacement rod and the company was very responsive, sending me one right away. Great customer service in my opinion. Most people don’t care about spine alignment but I do. Otherwise I would have given them five stars. Like I said, for the money, it’s hard to go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: J. S. Ferrier

customer_reviews.title: worthless for casting
customer_reviews.text: All the reviews claiming remarkable casting distance from this rod are BS there is now way that this rod with a tiny little 30 mm stripping guide is casting anything with any distance! Unless they are using a grossly undersized reel there is no way to avoid line slap and reduced distance from this otherwise beautiful rod! Fit and fisish are nice for this price point, too bad it doesn't preform as well as it looks!!!!! REALLY disappointed!!!! I can not recommend this rod, go buy an Okuma at the same price point and see what a stripper guide is supposed to look like!!!! Bare min 40mm!
customer_reviews.author: teresa l braun

customer_reviews.title: Did fine fishing the Cape Cod Canal throwing heavy 5oz jigs
customer_reviews.text: For the price you won't beat this rod. Did fine fishing the Cape Cod Canal throwing heavy 5oz jigs. Had no issues landing sharks over 50 pounds from the beach with this rod either. I trust this more than my $200 lamiglas rod. The bottom knob fell off but a minor complaint for the price. Would highly recommend and will be buying another for this upcoming season
customer_reviews.author: Matt M

customer_reviews.title: Nice rod, great value
customer_reviews.text: Bought this two piece 12' rod for surf fishing on the Texas Coast. Specifically along Galveston Island and Padre Island. I did a lot of research and finally settled on Fiblink 12' for $59.99. I compared it to a 12' I was almost tempted to buy at Cabela's for $99 and glad I bought the Fiblink. Used itlast month in June 2019 surf fishing on Galveston Island throwing both artificial lures and cut bait with spider weights. Fabulous casting distance. Handled the 4 oz spider weight and cut bait just fine but probably pushed the limit slightly on the long cast. Ended up landing 4 shark about 2-1/2' each. This rod so far has proved to be an excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Rod looked great, didn't last a single cast.
customer_reviews.text: The rod looked great, but unfortunately did not last a single cast. It was rigged up with a 3oz weight on a simple fish finder rig, with a single live mullet (about 4") as bait. A 12' surf rod should be able to handle that easily, but on the first cast, the last 10" or so snapped clean off, right in the center between 2 eyelets. Possibly mine was flawed, but now I need to see if I can get another half to this one.
customer_reviews.author: JR Smith

customer_reviews.title: Extreme value
customer_reviews.text: I have been surf fishining for over 45 years and in a pinch I ordered this rod because I needed an extra one very quickly. Boy was I surprised at the casting response, sensitivity and strength of this Fiblink spinning rod. It held up great to 5 days of hard fishing and helped me pull in a pretty good black drum! I still can't believe the value of this rod as it is as good as rods that I own that cost hundreds more. I really recommend this spinning rod! I look forward to using it again and again!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Worst product I have received, this is in terms of damaged goods. I received the item damaged in many places, the tip of the rod with the first guide on the top piece was broken off along with the bottom guide one being bent. The guide on the bottom half of the 2-piece rod was broken to bits. The handle had a scuff on it. I have provided pictures of the damages, I was very disappointed and was hopeful, I would definitely recommend looking elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Xyooj

customer_reviews.title: Nice rod for price
customer_reviews.text: I live in North East, couldn't wait to try rod out. Went to Connecticut River and gave it a try. I put a 3oz. Diamond jig on and launched it. The jig just kept going and going had to be over 100 yards. I loosed up drag to see how it would perform in a heavy fast current. Did great can't wait to try out in. Stripper season this rod is similar to tsunami looks identical which costs up to 200.00
customer_reviews.author: jackie rj

customer_reviews.title: Shop local
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this product and seller, I have received a used product and I have pictures shown to prove it. Cracked eyes, clear and obvious wear and abuse to a supposedly "new" rod. This is also the " upgraded" rod $61 and this is what I receive... shameful and disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Zack T

customer_reviews.title: Will snap
customer_reviews.text: Used maybe 15 times surf fishing. Biggest catch was 20#, but snapped in half when pulling in a 2# blue fish. Not what I expected for the price. Keep in mind, I rinse daily and store all my gear indoors. It snapped right above the the 2 piece connector on the small end of the pole.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Jury is still out.
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these rods that are identical. One had the end guide insert and a mid point guide insert when I had a king mackerel burning up my reel and I started to really apply pressure to the rod tip and the liner popped out and when I lowered the rod an in line guide liner broke loose. That is why I bought new guides and tips- Oh bring back the titanium guides!
customer_reviews.author: David F. Whitesell

customer_reviews.title: very nice rods nice feel high end finish have not hooked ...
customer_reviews.text: very nice rods nice feel high end finish have not hooked into a big enough fish to test fully have taken some 20 lbs Toro on them these fish fight hard, easily handled them. They cast a very long ways with 40 lb power pro hard to tell how far I was able to cast past the breakers with 4 ounce cabo killer maybe 200 yards. I will say lost sight of lure until it hit the water that's a long ways. Rod is a little heavy but for the money a outstanding deal.
customer_reviews.author: Yudane Wilson

customer_reviews.title: LIGHTWEIGHT AND LONGCASTING SURF ROD FOR A GOOD PRICE
customer_reviews.text: THIS REVIEW IS FOR THE 12 FT. FIBLINK SURF SPINNING ROD 2 PIECE (MOONSNIPER) NICE ROD FOR THE PRICE! LIGHTWEIGHT. SPOOLED W/ 30 LB BRAID. SO FAR SO GOOD. NO PROBLEMS. EXCELLENT LONG CASTING ROD. I CAN CAST MY 7 OZ. GEMINI TORPEDO WEIGHTS AT LEAST 100YDS EASY!! CATCHING A LOT OF FISH WITH THIS ROD. I'VE YET TO TRY PLUGGING WITH IT. WILL UPDATE THIS REVIEW AFTER A FEW ROUNDS OF PLUGGING. 7/3/17 UPDATE. I TOOK THIS ROD TO THE BEACH TO PLUG. GOT SKUNKED. I THINK THIS ROD IS A BIT TOO STIFF FOR PLUGGING. I'M NOT GOING TO GIVE UP THAT EASY. WILL UPDATE AGAIN SOON.
customer_reviews.author: Youngstalife

customer_reviews.title: The eye guides break easily,
customer_reviews.text: I have five rods and three have had broken eye guides. It is a shame that the rods do not hold up well I have used each rod only once and three of the five have broken eye inserts. The company sent me the tips to replace the ones the broke , now it is the eye closer to the reel that broke.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Second time used pole shattered
customer_reviews.text: Second time second time I'm out on a pond, not a river yet, testing things out. Got a good hook set, pole shattered. See pictures about related to this review. Would not suggest buying this Pole.....
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: It WAS my favorite rod.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loved this rod. I paired it with a kastking Sharky baitfeeder 3 6000 series reel. I caught many fish with it including my personal best 33 inch striped bass from the beach. Unfortunately, recently the rod tip bent and broke off. Bummed about it. Not sure if I am 100% going to recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Darin

customer_reviews.title: I would buy it again
customer_reviews.text: I’m a novice and this is the first rod I purchased at this price point (upgraded from a Walmart combo). Love the rod, weight, feel and action. 3rd use I snapped the end trying to free a snagged lure. Truth is I may have forced it to a poor angle but Fiblink customer service responded to my email in under 24 hours and had a replacement rod to my door less than 2 weeks later, no questions asked. As a novice, I’m not certain if I mishandled or if the rod should have withstood the snag but either way, I would purchase this and other Fiblink products again.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Laddy

customer_reviews.title: It put me where the fish were.
customer_reviews.text: Great rod. Love the colors and action. Allowed me to cast way over others at the pier to bring in those croaker at Solomons Island Fishing pier. Breaks down easy and packaged well. I'm taking it to Sandy Point beach soon and test it out.
customer_reviews.author: Dorrien

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with flimsy packaging-guide broken
customer_reviews.text: I’m really disappointed with the packaging for this rod. The box arrived bent in several places. When I opened the box, there was only wrapping paper inside the box to protect the rod sections. When I pulled the rods out, I noticed one of the guides was bent and the pieces of ceramic lining fell out of the cloth. After spending $69 on a rod, I expected more sturdy protective packaging. I don’t have enough time to send it back because I was planning on using it this weekend. I’ll make it work, but I won’t buy anything from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: MikeCinSA

customer_reviews.title: Well built and definitely worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rod just so I could let my sons use it instead of my more expensive rods, I spoiled it with 30 lbs braid, I took it out to try it and was really surprised how well it cast and felt, I decided to start using it and ended up buying a few more and have not had any problems with them, they are well built and can handle larger fish and Ray's, I have the 10ft and 12 ft models and both have held up really well. These rods are just as good as my higher cost rods and have not had a single problem with them and they get used every day weather permitting.
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: Nice rod up until my wife broke the top half
customer_reviews.text: Caught striped bass and perch. I was worried at first the rod would be too stiff to feel smaller perch biting but wasn't an issue. Liked how lightweight it was. Definitely skinnier then other rods I've had in the past but easy to get use to. Only complaint I had was the rod tip guide. My line kept getting tangled because of the how the metal supports for the top guide went over on top of the rod and that created a lip that my line(30lb braid) kept getting caught on. Maybe adding a drop of eproxy where that lip is might help prevent the line getting stuck in there.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: These rods are by far the best value on the market
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 12' casting rod and 10' spinning rods. These rods are by far the best value on the market. Quality easily meets or exceeds rods costing 2 or 3 times as much. I am sure you won't find a better quality rod for anywhere near the same cost. Customer service is amazing and I received the rods nicely packaged in a nylon bag. I can't wait to put them to use on the gulf coast.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Fishing eye broke after five times using
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product in September of 2018 and have used it maybe five times. The last eye broke for no reason. It just split on one side. I tried to contact the manufacturer and they have no contact information on Amazon Storefront or online web site. Stay with a name brand you can get in contact with if you should develop a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Greencliff

customer_reviews.title: Rod Tip Eye Broke on First Trip
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these rods for a recent trip to the OBX to use surf fishing. While I am no expert on what to look for in surf fishing rods, I feel that the price of these items along with the positive reviews make them worth trying. I did encounter a problem with one of the rods while fishing and that was the rod tip eye came off. The rod tip did not break, the guide eye simply broke from the guide sleeve. I am unsure as to what to do about this given my 30 day warranty expired prior to me actually using the product?
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Excellent rod for the money
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2ea 11 foot and 2ea 12 foot 2 piece rods. Have not used them yet but they appear to be exceptionally made for the price. Guides are nice and wraps / epoxy are very nice. Great handles, these rods are gonna be great. Love the action. I compared them to some $100 plus rods, and feel that these are much nicer. Thrilled. If I could offer any advice, I wish the ad listed the tip and butt diameters. These are perfect for me but I bet this info would sell more rods.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice features too flexible 12 ft
customer_reviews.text: This rod has nice features. If I saw it at the store I would have bought it considering the price. That being said, it could use a little more backbone. This rod flexes almost all the way to the reel which makes it more difficult retrieve even the lightest of fish.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent rod!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent starter rod. It is lightweight, solid, has enough action to enjoy the experience, and is affordable. What is not to like?!?! Like others have mentioned, the packing was pretty haphazard. Thankfully, my rod arrived without damage - which was probably a miracle, given the complete lack of protection Amazon provided.
customer_reviews.author: sarge504para

customer_reviews.title: Excellent rod
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this rod and paired it with my Penn Pursuit 8000, put on 25lb blue Elmax mono line, I can cast a country mile with it, rod feels good, not too stiff, at least not to me, it came with a carrying bag, so far, I just got the rod, I will update if needed after I catch some fish with it. but it think it will not disappoint!!!
customer_reviews.author: Poncho

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with the built quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well-built rod. Very light in weight. The handle is a little too thin but once I'm used to it, it felt very comfortable plus I have small hands. Will see how it will hold up after several trips. Update: ordered 4 more for fishing buddies and they all love it. It was used mainly for mullets snagging (dont judge me, it is the only to catch them, fun and legal). The rods are holding up well after a season (2 months) of constant jerkings and casting of 3-4 ounce weights.
customer_reviews.author: John N

customer_reviews.title: It's a very good looking rod
customer_reviews.text: I've got my 12 foot rod last week and tried it pier fishing. It's a very good looking rod, very light and good quality rod. I felt so lucky choosing this rod to other more expensive ones. I paired it with okuma bait feeder trio 80....👍👍 a highly recommended rod for those who are on a tight budget....I hope to get the 10 foot rod soon. 🎣😁
customer_reviews.author: kerwin teves

customer_reviews.title: Came with broken guide
customer_reviews.text: Rod seems well made, will be taking it out next weekend for some surf fishing. Giving it 2 stars because it came with the ceramic ring missing from the tiptop, kind of sucks to have to bring a brand new rod in for repairs before the trip since we’ll be using braid and it is unusable at the moment. Will update with catches!
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: very good quality and looking rod for $55 you can buy
customer_reviews.text: very good quality and looking rod for $55 you can buy, (the 10'). very light,,, u may feel it's too small in your hands,,,but i'm getting to like it more and more when i cast with it. Fiblink makes good rods,,,hope they will keep up with quality and and this very fair price.
customer_reviews.author: heng

customer_reviews.title: Bad Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: Rod looks to be well made but arrived with the interior tip damaged. Not worth returning during these COVID shipping times and I think I can superglue it without affecting performance. Still disappointed with the QC, as it doesn’t appear to have damage to the shipping material.
customer_reviews.author: S.R.D.

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a good quality rod but the product I recieved was damaged.
customer_reviews.text: I like that this rod was lightweight, the only negative was the product that I recieved was damaged/not in good condition. I returned it the same day it arrived because one of the rod piece was damaged/crushed as shown in the photos I have attached.
customer_reviews.author: B.G.

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Bought two poles to surf fish in Florida. Went fishing a couple of times and noticed the tippett and the second eyelet were missing the ceramic inserts. Also the eyelets were beginning to rust. When I got home from Florida sent an email to Fiblink. Tammy was very helpful and sent me a replacement rod right away. Hopefully this one will hold up better.
customer_reviews.author: Richard W. Ely

customer_reviews.title: Great rod for the price.  Light and durable.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great deal on a rod. I didn't catch any fish but was throwing a lot 3oz spoon and crankbait. The rod is light and not heavy considering it's a 10 footer. Highly recommend this rod.
customer_reviews.author: ImAzonAddiCt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome rod!
customer_reviews.text: Equivalent in feel and performance to my St Croix, light with nice action at less than half the price of my St Criox. I'll buy a few more before the vendor gets wise and bumps his price! Awesome surf rod!
customer_reviews.author: D Brosan

customer_reviews.title: Not all the sensitivity I wanted, but great rod
customer_reviews.text: For the money, it’s a great rod. I’ve caught small fish and big fish from the surf. I like my smaller 7’6” rod for sensitivity, but this rod is ideal for bigger fights. Overall, great all around.
customer_reviews.author: Luckycraftdave

customer_reviews.title: You can feel the fight, love it
customer_reviews.text: Paired the rod with a Diawa reel 4000 and love it. The rod is light, you can feel the sensitivity of the rod when reeling in the fish, you also get a great fight while it holds strong. I loved it so much I had to purchase 2 more, because my husband kept using mine and my dad love it too!
customer_reviews.author: Happy consumer ST

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Low quality eye loops made with plastic ring in guide that cracks and falls out. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: There will be breakage
customer_reviews.text: As others have posted, you get what you pay for. I think I might have been able to cast this rod seven times. There is no give to this rod, and the stiff cheap components make it very very easy to break this brittle rod. I succeeded to do it using 20 lb test with a 3 oz weight. A surf rod isn't really a surf rod if you can't cast it. At that point you're buying a wall piece for a Long John Silvers.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Carey

customer_reviews.title: This product is very light and durable. I am ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is very light and durable. I am using a lamiglas insane rod but this product is quite similar to lamiglas in terms of design, a back bone, structure, quality and feeling. In addition, I lost a bottom cap because of my mistake. Yet thanks to the seller's generous support, I would be able to get that cap free of charge even though I bought it in the last year.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Pak

customer_reviews.title: Seemed Promising
customer_reviews.text: At first glance, the 10ft 2pc rod that I purchased was beautiful. It had a nice slim sleek design and was very light weight. I had high hopes for this rod especially because of its many positive reviews. However, the first time I took it out to go surf fishing, it snapped. With the rod I was using 15lb mono line and my drag was definitely not set too tight. Hopefully this does not happen to the next person that purchases this rod.
customer_reviews.author: Reymar

customer_reviews.title: Great quality. Must have rod for surf fishing.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these after a friend recommended them, I needed 12' rod to upgrade from my 10' and this rod blew all my expectations out of the water. Its a great rod. Its extremely light and has enough action where you can still tell when you have small fish on the surf and the play helps for those long distance casts. And you can't beat the price. My only regret with this rod is that I only got 1 and now the 12' are out of stock. I want to get at least another 2.
customer_reviews.author: Alvin

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2 uses
customer_reviews.text: What I thought was a solid surf casting rod was not. The rod broke just below the reel. Return window is closed but will never buy again anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: TIP BROKE ON FIRST DAY
customer_reviews.text: Tip snapped on first day. The top of the rod just completely snapped off. Was attaching the hook below the first eye and the top snapped. Worked great until then. W
customer_reviews.author: Tech Exec

customer_reviews.title: Great rod at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great rod. Not just for the price but at a much higher price. The action is great and I can really get the line off my reel when I cast.
customer_reviews.author: Peter A. Tripp

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: 10 mark's for protecting the tip. Nice packaging too. Overall the rod is just as seen in the picture, haven't used it as yet though.
customer_reviews.author: Adams

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: The 10" rod works great. Tried it with 3 oz and 4 oz weights and it shot them beyond the breakers. The rod is comparable in weight and action to a Penn Prevail.
customer_reviews.author: Albert C. Majaika

customer_reviews.title: Best Bang for your Buck
customer_reviews.text: Awesome rod. Exactly as described. My reel that goes on it will be here tomorrow. Purchased this rod for Surf Fishing and Cat fishing. Very light for the size and comfortable in the hand. Best bang for the buck if you shop around.
customer_reviews.author: Jason C.

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service . Small guide ring at tip is loose and keeps turning.
customer_reviews.text: Product worked great... But only took out twice and the smallest guide ring on the top is now loose and keeps turning... How do I get this fix? Update: customer service was great. They sent me replacements.
customer_reviews.author: Lun

customer_reviews.title: No so Great, actually awful surf rod for the money
customer_reviews.text: TOP SECTION OF ROD SNAPPED IN HALF ON FIRST CAST. 9/2/20 UPDATE: So after first cast with just a Sabiki rig this is the result! Incredibly bummed out, a waste of my quality time and money. Rod lokked great, no visible flaws. Complete junk
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Amanuel

customer_reviews.title: Cast far and continuously all day!
customer_reviews.text: This rod is not only a great value, it's a great rod! The tough onstruction, light weight, and nice balance are qualities you expect from a much higher priced rod. You can hold this rod and cast all day continuously wihout fatigue.
customer_reviews.author: Kern Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great value, company stands behind their product
customer_reviews.text: Seller stands behind their rod. Rod itself is a great value for the money. Sending a new one due to a small factory defect. Am pleased with this company
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Hill

customer_reviews.title: I'll be using the other rod tomorrow to see if it holds up any better.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these rods, took out one today and it broke about a foot from tip on the second cast. Rod is labeled for a 4oz-8oz weight, was using a 5oz and a chunk of squid. I'll be using the other rod tomorrow to see if it holds up any better. *****Update I'll give the company the benefit of the doubt, the second rod held up to a full day of fishing. 1 star -> 3 star. Hopefully the first one was just a bad blank.
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality on par with rods I've used that were nearly double the price.
customer_reviews.text: Fiblink has impressed me again with the quality for the money they provide. Looking forward to testing these out on a Texas coast trip for drum/Jack's this Sunday. As always the customer service was well above avg (I've purchased other models 3 times now).
customer_reviews.author: Charles J.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: best shore rod for the money by far. i used it at Pacifica Pear for crab using a crab snare 4 ounce plus bait in the snare, plenty of power to be casted over 150 yards out and no fears of breaking the rod. Already bought another one, very happy.
customer_reviews.author: seamus howard

customer_reviews.title: Easily broken
customer_reviews.text: Broke the first time I used it. Less than 100 casts. Top end of the reel section that fits inside section two just shattered. No fish, no snag, just normal use. Definitely not medium/ heavy action. 4 piece, 11’ surf rod.
customer_reviews.author: Fisherman 59

customer_reviews.title: Worse than buying a rod at the local IGA grocery store.
customer_reviews.text: I would give this zero stars if possible. Very excited to use the rod. Felt great. But I heard a HUGE snap on the second cast. On the fourth cast it snapped in half. And I was actually trying to cast easy as I didn’t want to cast the bait too far out or I would be in deep grass. Great looks. HORRIBLE QUALITY.
customer_reviews.author: Dotyjr

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality!
customer_reviews.text: This rod is a piece of junk!!! Got it for my Husband’s Birthday and it broke on the first cast!!!! Apparently I can’t return it because I had 1 month to return but we didn’t go on out fishing trip until three weeks after his birthday! I wish you had a negative star rating!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Feels and Looks Well Made!
customer_reviews.text: I am, as others here are, surprised at the quality of this rod for the price. It is light, sturdy, and well, purdy. The only thing I found while combing it over was a small scratch on the 'F' of the Fiblink logo. Other than that, shipped as promised with a sleeve to store it in. I give it four stars saving the last one for when I give it go on the Oregon Coast in a week. I will be pairing this with an Okuma Ceymar 40 reel and 30lb high visibility braid for Black Rockfish from the Jetty and Red Tail Surf Perch from the shore.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Great pole for the money
customer_reviews.text: Tried this pole for the price it had. So far loving it! Works great! I got the 10’ pole. The action on the tip isn’t too fast but wondering if the 12’ is a little more sensitive. Would get another one with no problem!
customer_reviews.author: joel paires

customer_reviews.title: otherwise it appears like a niece rod
customer_reviews.text: Guide was broken when I unpacked the rod. I am a rod builder and since i am going on a trip in a few days I don't have time to return it for a new one, so I stripped the guide of and replaced it, otherwise it appears like a niece rod.
customer_reviews.author: Fisherman

customer_reviews.title: Cheep but works. (Not " I repeat ( not )  Chinese Junk.!!!
customer_reviews.text: Can through a 2 once weight line, hook, float a two hundred feet no problem!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rabbit and Joyce Naahel u Hi.

customer_reviews.title: Rod guides are awesome and smooth. Added Pursuit II Reel perfect fit!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered an Okuma Rod at first. It came to my house andooked horrible and was defective. I returned it ordered Fiblink 10ft surf rod and it is Perfection. I HIGHLY RECCOMEND THIS ROD.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Wright

customer_reviews.title: Well made.  Well insulated
customer_reviews.text: I like them. Boot rubs on one side that left a nasty abrasion, but that is easily remedied. Hopefully as they are worn more that will resolve itself.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It held up well against a big fish
customer_reviews.text: Looks good felt good and fought good. Photo below was my 1st fishing trip with it. I caught a 40 plus lbs Stingray. I'm only giving 4 stars because I really honestly know nothing about rods or reels or fishing but it seems like a good rod for the price
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Dont let the price fool you!!!
customer_reviews.text: For the money you cant beat this surf rod. I have bought a lot of rods over the years that cost significantly more than this one and I do believe the grip and handle is the best Ive ever had!!! Obviously the sensitivity isn't as good because its graphite but for its intended purpose its fantastic!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value and a solid rod
customer_reviews.text: Finally took this surf fishing. Casts a mile. Breaks down easily. Very happy with it. Looking forward to taking it on plane (I got the 13' 4 piece rod)- will fit easily in overhead.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Koch

customer_reviews.title: Quality at a great price !
customer_reviews.text: Rod came as described. Was very pleased with the quality of the guides and the overall construction of the rod. I use it for stripers and hybrids in rough water below a dam. This rod casts well and is sensitive yet strong enough to pull a large fish in current on a river.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Rossini

customer_reviews.title: Loved having a good product and durability!
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME fishing rod and very sensitive,you can really tell when the fish takes your lutes.
customer_reviews.author: Ernie

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it, works as well as my rods 5x the price
customer_reviews.author: Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Nice rod
customer_reviews.text: Well made rod that casts well. Wish it had a slightly softer tip for pompano fishing,but a really nice rod.
customer_reviews.author: jac

customer_reviews.title: Good rod
customer_reviews.text: Nice rod so far. Threw the same tackle same distance as my friend with a mojo surf. Not as light as a blank, but for cut bait on the surf it’s nice.
customer_reviews.author: Pleasant1911

customer_reviews.title: Very nice rod
customer_reviews.text: Nice rod. Unfortunately I’ve yet to hook a fish that bends this over. The tip did fall off at one point but that was an easy repair.
customer_reviews.author: Gabel

customer_reviews.title: Great rods and great value.
customer_reviews.text: This review is long overdue. I like this rod very much, and have reeled in some nice strippers with it, great with 3-4 oz lures. Of particular note is the great customer service I experienced with them, they really want their customers to be satisfied and needless to say I am. -Sean
customer_reviews.author: Sean O'Neill

customer_reviews.title: Good pole
customer_reviews.text: Used this pole a couple of times. Love it so far. No issues so far
customer_reviews.author: barett

customer_reviews.title: Great rod
customer_reviews.text: Have used it a couple of times so far. Great for casting. Use it with a Penn fierce7000. No complaints so far. Buying another one soon. Shipped quickly and had no issues with damages.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Lizama

customer_reviews.title: Great Rod
customer_reviews.text: Paired it up with a Penn Battle 3! Fish don't have a chance. Best 2-piece rod on the market
customer_reviews.author: Bernard

customer_reviews.title: Get one...!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful rod awesome flexibility and the Quality is awesome and you can’t beat the price. I’m getting one more for my son we love surf fishing amazing casting with this rod.
customer_reviews.author: Mario Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Undoubtably the BEST fishing rod
customer_reviews.text: One of the best rods I’ve ever had I have four of them , the strength and the lightness of it will amaze you. A super buy for the price !!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff nelson

customer_reviews.title: A great buy
customer_reviews.text: The rod is great I love how light weight it is, but the package that it was shipped in was open over half way and crushed. I'm just glad the rod wasn't broken.
customer_reviews.author: George streeter

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value! Held up well. Very sturdy. Will purchase more
customer_reviews.author: Derrick M.

customer_reviews.title: 11 foot 4 piece was great for surf fishing North Carolina
customer_reviews.text: The 11 foot rod did a great job casting 4 oz sinkers, and I was very pleased with the action and power of the rod when casting long distances.
customer_reviews.author: too late smart...

customer_reviews.title: Pompano Killer
customer_reviews.text: Love the rod, quality is better than I expected and it already has a few pompano to it's credit . It took two tries to get a rod here in one piece, if they can package them better for shipping they have a winner. Wish they had a 15 footer!
customer_reviews.author: Robert L

customer_reviews.title: A great rod!
customer_reviews.text: I will have more of these rods. I am fishing this rod hard the last week of June 2019 and it has been amazing. I was able to hook two sharks, the largest a 5 footer and the rod easily handled each. The action is great for casting to and fighting large fish.
customer_reviews.author: Grandpa Ray

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: 12ft pole great value. A little whippy at the tip. Handles fish in heavy surf very well. For the money it's a no brainers. Definitely would buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great rod for the money
customer_reviews.text: Nice 12’ rod. Surf fish a good bit and the longer rods are a must to get your bait out there when the water and air are cold. Nice tip movement and comes apart to store easier than other rods.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Toothman

customer_reviews.title: Great rod
customer_reviews.text: Very good rod for the price cast like a dream
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Small

customer_reviews.title: Best Bang for the $$
customer_reviews.text: This rod out performs some of the higher cost Penn that I have. Caught many striped bass and perch up here in north California with it. Excellent customer service as I was promptly took care of with a small issue that I have. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: DonK

customer_reviews.title: Yesssssss!
customer_reviews.text: This rod is exactly what I needed. Less expensive than others. Very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Rod tip came off
customer_reviews.text: Rod tip lasted 2 casts. I think I can glue back. Other than that seems like a nice rod.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny12gauge

customer_reviews.title: Fail
customer_reviews.text: Guides are not stainless steel. Thats a deal killer for a surf rod. Rust after 2 uses.
customer_reviews.author: Jackster

customer_reviews.title: Great casting with a nice rod. Go catch some big fish!
customer_reviews.text: Great rod and able to cast really far. I caught a couple of big red drums with it. Unfortunately, after I caught a big red, the tip of the rod broke because my hook and line got tangled in sea weeds. I managed to pull that weight and the tip broke right when I got close to shore. The customer service is excellent. They sent me a new rod and i’ll start using it very soon. Thank you Fiblink!
customer_reviews.author: Adi

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Broken
customer_reviews.text: Like so many others, my rod arrived with one of the sections snapped in two. I don't understand how they continue to allow this to happen. I ordered another one, but I leave tomorrow night for a fishing tournament. I hope it arrives in time.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart D. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Nice pole for the price
customer_reviews.text: My first impression of the pole is, it's good looking. Looks like it is made of quality materials and assembled well. Although it haven't used it yet I'm sure it would be fine for what I fish for.
customer_reviews.author: N_Cervantes

customer_reviews.title: Amazing action and feeling
customer_reviews.text: I took this rod along to fish for strippers and sharks off the surf and it did great its a little big but i stand at 6'4 so I have no problem with it. The rod its self has a great action and really allows you to feel the difference between the bottom and structure vs a fish.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not happy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Total bust right out of the box. First eyelet was completely bent and had no guiding like the rest. It would have cut the line the very first cast. Amazon has been a joke on my last 5 fishing purchases!!!!! Not happy!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great rod! Very pleased by performance!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Took fighing - impressed by performance. Light and strong, allows casted far. Pretty strong to take out sharks and scates. Recomend!
customer_reviews.author: Elena

customer_reviews.title: I really like the rod,but something happened, please help me
customer_reviews.text: After fishing on this rod for a couple days and i like it, but I don’t know what is wrong with the tip, this is my first surf fishing rod, please help me out
customer_reviews.author: my le

product_meta.title: Fiblink Surf Spinning Fishing Rod 2-Piece Graphite Travel Fishing Rod(12-Feet & 10-Feet)
feature_bullets: Sensitive and Solid Carbon Fiber Construction - Carbon construction for improved performance-action and increased sensitivity. The rod delivers the extraordinary toughness of solid carbon fiber construction and precisely tuned action for boat fishing.

High Performance - Stainless steel mixed with ceramic guide makes it more smooth, aviods line stucking in the guides, minimize friction for smooth, long casts, while also enhancing sensitivity by transferring vibrations from the line through the guide to the rod and to your hand. The guides are precisely aligned, along the bottom of the spine of the blank which is perfectly straight and true.

Non Slip Rubber Shrink Tube Handle - Non slip rubber shrink tube handle with tapered rear grip. Tip over butt ferrule connection for maximum strength and durability Machined tapered hood transitions above and below.
Extreme Exposure Reel Seat - Wheel seat with stainless steel tapered hood transitions above and below reel seat protecting cap.

One Year Warranty - 1 Year warranty against any defects! Just feel free to contact seller if there is anything wrong with the Fiblink Fishing Rod, we will solve your problem asap. Money back for non-artificial damage and 100% satisfaction!

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
